tool.name: USNGTileLayout

param.name: Boundary_Shapefile_Path
param.dialogReference: Shapefile boundary the tile layout wil be based on.
param.pythonReference: Boundary the tile layout will be based on. The boundary needs to have a projection. The tool can also be run on a DGN polygon but the output shapefile wil not have projection information.

param.name: Width
param.dialogReference: Tile Width. The length will be the same as the coordinate system. The horizontal length of the tiles, the X value.
param.pythonReference: Tile Width. The length will be the same as the coordinate system. The horizontal length of the tiles, the X value.

param.name: Height
param.dialogReference: Tile Height. The length will be the same as the coordinate system. The vertical length of the tiles, the Y value.
param.pythonReference: Tile Height. The length will be the same as the coordinate system. The vertical length of the tiles, the Y value.

param.name: UTM_Zone
param.dialogReference: UTM Zone Number. Specifiies UTM Zone. If the layout crosses multiple UTM zones this option will name all the tiles according to the UTM zone specified.
param.pythonReference: UTM Zone Number. Specifiies UTM Zone. If the layout crosses multiple UTM zones this option will name all the tiles according to the UTM zone specified.

tool.summary: This tool creates a layout based on Woolpert's formula for tile creation. The USNG naming will be based on USNG standards. The width and height can be set to the user's specifications. The output shapefile will be the in the same coordinate system as the boundary tile.
tool.usage: This tool creates a layout based on Woolpert's formula for tile creation. The USNG naming will be based on USNG standards. The width and height can be set to the user's specifications. The output shapefile will be the in the same coordinate system as the boundary tile.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool creates a layout based on Woolpert's formula for tile creation. The USNG naming will be based on USNG standards. The width and height can be set to the user's specifications. The output shapefile will be the in the same coordinate system as the boundary tile.
